symptoms.name: Eye damage
symptoms.pattern: Can range from mild to severe, depending on the location and extent of the infection.

symptoms.name: Flu-like symptoms
symptoms.pattern: May occur in some cases, but are not always present.

symptoms.name: Swollen lymph nodes
symptoms.pattern: May occur in some cases, but are not always present.

symptoms.name: Muscle aches and pains
symptoms.pattern: May occur in some cases, but are not always present.

physical_findings: Eye findings may vary depending on the severity and location of the infection.  May include inflammation, lesions, or visual impairment.
risk_factors: Congenital infection (although this is coded separately as P37.1)

required: Clinical presentation consistent with toxoplasma oculopathy (e.g., eye inflammation, lesions, visual impairment)
supportive: Positive serological tests for Toxoplasma gondii antibodies
Imaging findings suggestive of toxoplasmosis (e.g., retinal lesions)
